page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our area is in the very north east corner of the county of Devon.In fact the county boundary is only about half a mile from our school.We are on the very edge of a part of Devon which is very hilly and if we climb to the top of Chimney Down there is a good view for many miles to the east,north and south.It is quite a steep climb up to Hockworthy and Staple Cross but we go downhill to Westleigh and Burlescombe. We are on the edge of the Culm Valley although the River Culm is about six miles from us and we look across to the Blackdown Hills on the other side of the valley.The soil here is quite shallow and underneath there is shale stone.
